intro: Erythranthe calcicola, commonly known as the limestone rockscorpion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant typically grows in rocky, calcareous soils, often in mountainous regions. Its flowers are small, yellow, and clustered in racemes, and it blooms in the spring. Erythranthe calcicola is adapted to harsh, arid environments and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
